title: Medidata data documentation
text: Medidata electronic data capture system used clinical data IRONMAN. data deliveries work progress efficiently meet needs involved partners, subject change.

title: Medidata data documentation
text: clinical data medidata consists multiple tables; section shown corresponds different data table. Click triangle expand data table see individual fields. first 10 tables shown, click page numbers see tables search search bar field interest.
code: library(ironer) # ?dictionary_medidata # View(dictionary_medidata)

title: Medidata data documentation
text: single date field generally captured 6 variables. example, ca_cm ca_cm_derived tables field exstdat (treatment start date) :

title: Medidata data documentation
text: June 2024, cancer treatments consolidated single data frame (ca_cm, ca_cm_derived). forms EDC (electronic data capture) log line forms; record_position order entry form, represent anything beyond (.e., represent therapy order). Prior date, stored follows: priorrx (medical history/prior treatments) table ideally contains prostate cancer treatments patient’s medical history, informed consent signed IRONMAN study. treatment (cancer treatment) table contains prostate cancer treatment ongoing time informed consent treatments started study.

title: Medidata data documentation
text: possible, treatment regimens mapped standardized coding master treatment mapping file. master list created identifying yet mapped treatments personnel researching drug class, confirmed QC’d medical monitors question. treatment mapping continuously updated. Standardized treatment mapping contained ca_cm_derived. table contain information original ca_cm table, additionally provides: treatment_lower: entry lower case trt_treatment_recode: assigned standardized coding trt_treatment_category: assigned treatment category trt_is_taxel: treatment one Cabazitaxel, Docetaxel, Paclitaxel, Tesetaxel trt_is_nha : treatment novel hormonal agent (one Abiraterone, Enzalutamide, Darolutamide, Apalutamide)

title: Medidata data documentation
text: 6 computed / derived Gleason scores. general, gleason scores consist gleason 1 (max value 5) gleason 2 (max value 5) gleason sum (max value 10) However, sites occasionally enter Gleason sum either first Gleason scores. cleaned derived Gleason scores gleason 1 gleason 2 less equal five, total gleason score sum two first gleason score greater five, total gleason score taken first gleason score instance table multiple gleason scores per subject (e.g., study biopsy), largest gleason score sum carried forward subject table.

text: designation participant baseline metastatic looks across seven different tables. subject table: is_metastatic_baseline = 1 least one seven tables indicates presence metastatic disease origin_metastatic_baseline indicates want indicated metastatic status across seven tables date_metastatic_baseline earliest date metastatic flag recorded across seven tables

title: PROMS data documentation
text: Demographic questions asked across two different instruments (irondemog irondemog_v3). Due common usage race/ethnicity, questions combined two instruments analysis convenience. noted irondemog combined instrument, well medidata subject table. race.26.x (select question, x indicates numeric select option) race.26.1 coalesces values irondemog.26.1 irondemog_v3.26.1 race.26.2 coalesces values irondemog.26.2 irondemog_v3.26.2 etc. ethnicity.27, multiple choice question. coalesced irondemog.27 irondemog_v3.27

title: PROMS data documentation
text: Survey respondents asked height weight two part question. First, enter numeric value height weight, second enter unit measurement (inches/cm pounds/kg). measurements kept separate variables according unit indicated. Note also two different instruments, coalesced analysis. irondemog.3.1, irondemog_v3.3.1: height inches irondemog.3.2, irondemog_v3.3.2: height cm irondemog.5.1, irondemog_v3.5.1: weight pounds irondemog.5.2, irondemog_v3.5.2: weight kg

title: PROMS data documentation
text: 1. FACT-FPSI, 2 questions recorded (factfpsi_1 factfpsi_2)? Confirmed data set protocol 2 questions collected. 2. BPI, one two questions found. (ironmisc_12 ironmisc_13 ironmisc_v5_15 ironmisc_v5_16). Please advise process . responses combined across two protocol versions get complete set. 3. ironmisc indication questionnaire name? ironmisc questions miscellaneous questions part formal instrument; presented patients “feel, memory, sleep quality, pain”. 4. history epic23 vs epic26 implementation? EPIC-23 questionnaire used protocol versions 1 & 2 (EPIC-26 3 questions deleted overlap QOL instruments). EPIC-23 formal instrument, named reflect removed three questions EPIC-26. differing questions :

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: line therapy (lot) algorithm approximately assigns line therapy based logic described . manual review process, identified situations results algorithm align line therapy assessment domain expertise. making algorithm available hopes can provide rough approximation, please note gold standard truth. PCCTC working towards electronic data base updates easily accurately collect line therapy information. current version algorithm reasonably sufficient extract first line therapy.

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: Overall line therapy: use ca_cm_derived table full listing prior current treatments. study line therapy: either use ca_cm_derived filter treatments occur consent date. Disease state line therapy: researchers may interested line therapy specific disease state diagnosis, like mHSPC. , use ca_cm_derived filter treatments occur disease state diagnosis. Remove rows trt_treatment_category equal “ADT”, “Bisphosphonates”, “Steroid”, generally considered standalone line therapy. start date listed, remove row consideration; future data cuts hopefully queried information available.

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: assign_lot() internally. Sort table treatment start date, assign first line (1L) first entry, along entries occur within 30 day window date combo therapy. End line 1 (subsequent lines) treatment stop date listed therapies line. end date entered, use information step 8 new LOT entered. new treatments listed 30 days LOT start date become new LOT. treatments listed within 30 days new LOT start marked combo therapy LOT. Repeat LOTs assigned patient.

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: demonstration situation 1: “Overall line therapy.” Note takes minutes complete. prepared data looks like single subject: Example results subject. Note individual treatments still retained. can reduce data set summarized treatment regimens. subject appear :
code: library(dplyr) library(tibble) library(ironer) # stack prior treatments with on study treatments # rename variables to match between two data sets treatment_prep <-      medidata$ca_cm_derived |>         select(         subject, treatment, exstdat_int, exendat_int,          treatment_recode = trt_treatment_recode, treatment_category = trt_treatment_category       ) |>    # remove entries with missing start date   filter(!is.na(exstdat_int)) %>%    # remove treatments not counted as a line of therapy   filter(!treatment_category %in% c("Steroid", "Bone-Modifying Agent", "Bisphosphonates", "Antidiabetic")) |>    # keep relevant fields  select(subject, exstdat_int, exendat_int, treatment_category, treatment_recode) # assign line of therapy  treatment_lot <- treatment_prep |>     # sort by subject and treatment start date   arrange(subject, exstdat_int) |>    # within each subject, assign line of therapy   group_by(subject) |>    group_modify(~ ironer::assign_lot(     .data = .x,      # note, you could use treatment_category here as well to get a high level     # view of line of therapy by category     treatment = treatment_recode,     dt_trt_observed = exstdat_int,      dt_treatment_end = exendat_int     )) |>    ungroup() treatment_lot_summary <- treatment_lot |>    select(subject, lot, regimen, dt_lot_start, dt_lot_last_obs) |>    distinct()

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: Treatment data collected two independent forms: Cancer treatments (ca_cm) Physician questionnaires (multiple versions implemented across protocols) Data capture differs forms; forms independent, treatments may align across forms. Data Management team monitors issues queries improve alignment. Ironman research question inform source treatment data use, useful combine two sources treatment information.

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: Cancer treatments represent treatments occurred prior study enrollment study. Data collected log lines, one row per treatment. Cancer treatments used time--event analyses exact start stop date treatments required. entry includes treatment name, start date, stop date, modification reason, discontinuation reason, indication. Indication added June 2024 prior study treatment forms consolidated single form. ca_cm table represents raw cancer treatment data collected medidata. ca_cm_derived table additionally contains higher level treatment categories, standardized treatment coding, flags taxels NHAs (novel hormonal agents).

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: assumed patients anti-androgen simultaneously ADT, even ADT reported. Note may vary globally. assumed patient continuing ADT ever marked “far”. assumed patients mHSPC ADT, even marked. can cross checked treatments. systemic treatment listed “far” “starting” blank, visit associated “far” treatment imputed initial study treatment. Consider ignoring external beam radiation therapy treatment regimen. (“often patients mHSPC get radiation painful lesion something along starting systemic therapy.) data orchiectomies prsurg surg tables can incorporated.

what: Gather minimal data from cancer treatments form
title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: example data looks like single patient. Dates shifted protect patient’s identity.
code: df_treatments_all <- lst_blind_medidata$ca_cm_derived |>    select(     subject,     treatment = trt_treatment_recode,     dt_treatment_start = exstdat_int,     dt_treatment_end = exendat_int,     treatment_category = trt_treatment_category   ) |>    # remove blank treatments   filter(!is.na(treatment))|>   # sort by treatment start date within subject   arrange(subject, dt_treatment_start)

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: Depending research question, may want exclude treatments treatment categories relevant analysis. table displays treatments categorization. aware ADT (Androgen Deprivation Therapy) treatment classification includes LHRH agonists, LHRH antagonists, anti-androgens. Depending research question, may want implement different treatment classification narrowly defines ADTs interest.
code: df_treatments_all |>   count(treatment_category, treatment) |>    reactable(     resizable = TRUE   )

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: Occasionally treatments specifically cancer treatments entered medidata. following code excludes treatment categories specific prostate cancer. list regularly assessed ensure date accurate new data gets entered.
code: # vector of treatment categories that are not specifically prostate cancer treatments # and could be excluded from analysis of prostate cancer specific treatments trt_category_exclude <- c(   "Steroid", "Antidiabetic", "Antilipemic", "Nutraceuticals", "Bone-Modifying Agent",   "Bisphosphonates", "Nutraceutical", "Nutraceutical/Placebo", "Placebo", "COX-2 Inhibitor"   )  # create a new data frame that represents prostate cancer (pc) treatments only  df_treatments_pc <- df_treatments_all |>   # exclude these drug classes   filter(!treatment_category %in% trt_category_exclude)

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: Occasionally treatments entered different log lines break treatment end date next treatment start date. example, consider subject history shows Bicalutamide continuing rows 5 6, rows 7 8. analysis purposes, considered single treatment Bicalutamide represented 6 rows instead 8. code collapse consecutive overlapping records treatment.
code: #> # A tibble: 8 × 4 #>     row treatment    dt_treatment_start dt_treatment_end #>   <int> <chr>        <chr>              <chr>            #> 1     1 Bicalutamide 2001-04-09         2003-04-01       #> 2     2 Bicalutamide 2008-06-01         2008-09-01       #> 3     3 Bicalutamide 2009-06-24         2009-12-01       #> 4     4 Bicalutamide 2010-10-08         2011-06-01       #> 5     5 Bicalutamide 2012-09-01         2013-11-26       #> 6     6 Bicalutamide 2013-11-26         2014-12-01       #> 7     7 Bicalutamide 2015-01-01         2016-07-26       #> 8     8 Bicalutamide 2016-07-27         2017-04-04 #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>     row treatment    dt_treatment_start dt_treatment_end #>   <int> <chr>        <chr>              <chr>            #> 1     1 Bicalutamide 2001-04-09         2003-04-01       #> 2     2 Bicalutamide 2008-06-01         2008-09-01       #> 3     3 Bicalutamide 2009-06-24         2009-12-01       #> 4     4 Bicalutamide 2010-10-08         2011-06-01       #> 5     5 Bicalutamide 2012-09-01         2014-12-01       #> 6     6 Bicalutamide 2015-01-01         2017-04-04 df_treatments_pc_collapsed <- df_treatments_pc |>     arrange(      subject,       treatment,      dt_treatment_start,       desc(dt_treatment_end)      ) |>   mutate(     # examine each treatment within a subject     .by = c(subject, treatment),     # create a flag that represents truly unique lines of treatment     flag_unique_line = case_when(       # the first record represents a unique line       row_number() == 1 ~ TRUE,       # if treatment start date is after the previous treatment end date plus one,       # then we assume it represents a new line for that treatment.       dt_treatment_start > lag(dt_treatment_end) + 1 ~ TRUE,       # otherwise, if the treatment start date occurs before the previous treatment        # end date plus one, this is not a unique line       dt_treatment_start <= lag(dt_treatment_end) + 1 ~ FALSE,       # for instance of missing start or end date, the default value will assume a new new line       .default = TRUE),     # create a grouping variable that represents the total number of unique lines     group = cumsum(flag_unique_line),   ) |>    # # examine each treatment grouping within a subject   # for overlapping entries for a drug, take the earlier start date and later end date   mutate(     .by = c(subject, treatment, group),     dt_treatment_start_group = first(dt_treatment_start, na_rm = TRUE),     dt_treatment_end_group = last(dt_treatment_end, na_rm = TRUE)   ) |>    distinct(     subject,      treatment,      dt_treatment_start = dt_treatment_start_group,      dt_treatment_end = dt_treatment_end_group,      treatment_category   ) |>    arrange(     subject, dt_treatment_start   )

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: treatments form captures individual treatments, capture treatments administered simultaneously line therapy (LOT) treatment. line therapy given treatment can approximately derived using ironer::assign_lot function. Treatments considered LOT start dates within 30 days. Treatment end dates considered defining LOTs. Considerations: ADT usage ADT consistently captured, documentation usage ADT varies globally. 50% mHSPC patients ADT documented database. consider excluding ADT creating lines therapy, assume ADT usage even documented. code considers treatments initiated within 90 days enrollment per protocol patients must enrolled within 90 days starting systemic treatment. can modified needed. function can used assign line therapy based either treatment category specific treatment . Identify first line therapy study. example LOT data looks like single patient. Dates shifted protect patient’s identity.
code: # identify on study treatments df_treatments_onstudy <- df_treatments_pc_collapsed |>   # include consent date in order to exclude treatments >90 days before enrollment   left_join(lst_blind_medidata$ic |> select(subject, cnstdate_int), by = "subject") |>   mutate(     # day of treatment relative to consent date     trt_day_rel_consent = dt_treatment_start - cnstdate_int,     # consider treatment to be on study if within 90 days of consent date     trt_on_study = if_else(trt_day_rel_consent >= -90, TRUE, FALSE)   ) |>    # retain only on study treatments   filter(trt_on_study) # assign LOT while on study, by treatment category # be patient, this takes a bit to run # the result is the same dimension as the input data, i.e., one row per treatment df_lot_trt <- df_treatments_onstudy |>    arrange(subject, dt_treatment_start) |>   group_by(subject) |>   group_modify(~ assign_lot(     .x, treatment_category, dt_treatment_start, dt_treatment_end   )) |>   ungroup()   # modify the result to be one row per line of therapy # additionally retain all treatments in that line of therapy  df_lot <- df_lot_trt |>    select(     subject,      cnstdate_int,     treatment,     lot_on_study = lot,      regimen_on_study = regimen,      dt_lot_start,      dt_lot_last_obs   ) |>    # occasionally, identical treatments are consecutive and estimated to be part of    # the same LOT. distinct() here reduces the identical and consecutive treatments   # to one row   distinct() |>   # create an indicator for observed treatments, to be used in pivot   mutate(trt_ind = 1) |>    # create a single variable that represents all treatment in LOT   arrange(subject, lot_on_study, treatment) |>    group_by(subject, lot_on_study) |>    mutate(trt_on_study = str_c(treatment, collapse = ", "), .after = regimen_on_study) |>    ungroup() |>    # this makes treatment columns show in alphabetical order in the pivot step   arrange(treatment) |>    # wrangle the data from long to wide to create 1 row per LOT, with indicators   # for each individual treatment   pivot_wider(     # creates column names from the pivot     names_from = treatment,     # observed treatments are given a value of 1     values_from = trt_ind,     # treatments not observed are filled with a value of 0     values_fill = 0     ) |>    arrange(subject, lot_on_study, dt_lot_start)

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: Physician Questionnaire (PQ) completed treating physician baseline every 3-month visit. questionnaire asks treatments patient received far treatments patient starting. currently five versions PQ must combined analysis (PQs amended various protocol amendments). version separate table database different variable names. following table shows questions responses version PQ. PQ treatments useful assess cross-sectional association treatment PQ PROM measures linked visit. specific dates treatment PQ, challenging use time--event analyses. date PQ entered edc field record_date (though necessarily correspond date PQ completed physician). PQ associated visit (like Baseline, Month 3, etc), visit dates brought cyc_date form. Please list patient’s CURRENT / CHANGE TREATMENT(S) planning continuing androgen deprivation therapy patient? Open text field Yes/systemic treatments patient previously received prostate cancer? Choose apply. treatment patient starting? May select one combination Androgen deprivation therapy (surgical castration, LH-RH agonist/antagonist) option first question Enzalutamide Abiraterone acetate Docetaxel chemotherapy Radium-223 dichloride Sipuleucel-T Cabazitaxel chemotherapy Bicalutamide, anti-androgen Clinical Trial _______________ Abiraterone Androgen deprivation (LHRH, surgical) Apalutamide Bicalutamide anti-androgen Cabazitaxel Clinical trial Docetaxel Enzalutamide External beam radiation therapy metastatic disease Radium-223 Sipuleucel-T cancer-directed therapy (e.g., mitoxantrone) Symptom-oriented therapy (e.g., analgesics) Abiraterone Androgen deprivation (LHRH, surgical) Apalutamide Bicalutamide anti-androgen Cabazitaxel Clinical trial Docetaxel Enzalutamide External beam radiation therapy metastatic disease Radium-223 Sipuleucel-T cancer-directed therapy (e.g., mitoxantrone) Symptom-oriented therapy (e.g., analgesics) Darolutamide Niraparib Olaparib Rucaparib Talazoparib Pembrolizumab 177Lu-PSMA-617

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: Protocol versions 1 2 use version physician questionnaire. Due open text nature, challenging standardize treatments.
code: # use variable naming conventions that align with other pq aggregations df_pq1 <- lst_blind_medidata$pq |>    mutate(pq_version = "pq1") |>    select(pq_version, subject, instance_name, treatment = pq1, continuing_adt = pq2)

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: PQ3, pull data two separate steps: one far treatments one starting treatments. combine.
code: # Retrieve so far treatments df_pq3_sofar <- lst_blind_medidata$new_pq |>   select(subject, instance_name, matches("^newpq_4[a-i]$"), newpq_4iab, -contains("raw")) |>    # standardize treatment name through label   labelled::set_variable_labels(     newpq_4a = "ADT",     newpq_4c = "Abiraterone",     newpq_4d = "Docetaxel",     newpq_4e = "Radium-223",     newpq_4g = "Cabazitaxel",     newpq_4h = "Anti-androgen",     newpq_4i = "Clinical trial", # to standardize name across other PQs     subject = NULL,     instance_name = NULL,     newpq_4iab = "sofar_Other"   ) |>    # convert label to variable name   sjlabelled::label_to_colnames() |>    # create a set of new columns that contain the character string   # representing treatment continued so far   mutate(     across(       .cols = -c(subject, instance_name, sofar_Other),        .names = "sofar_{.col}",        .fns = \(x) case_when(         x == 1 ~ var_label(x),         .default = NA     ))   ) |>    select(subject, instance_name, contains("sofar")) |>    relocate(sofar_Other, .after = last_col())  # Retrieve starting treatments df_pq3_starting <- lst_blind_medidata$new_pq |>   select(subject, instance_name, matches("^newpq_5[a-h]"), newpq_5ia, -contains("raw")) |>    # standardize treatment name through label   labelled::set_variable_labels(     newpq_5b = "Abiraterone",     newpq_5c = "Docetaxel",     newpq_5d = "Radium-223",     newpq_5f = "Cabazitaxel",     newpq_5g = "Anti-androgen",     newpq_5h = "Clinical trial",  # to standardize name across other PQs     subject = NULL,     instance_name = NULL,     newpq_5ia = "starting_Other",   ) |>    # convert label to variable name   sjlabelled::label_to_colnames() |>    # create a set of new columns that contain the character string   # representing treatment starting   mutate(     across(       .cols = -c(subject, instance_name, starting_Other),        .names = "starting_{.col}",        .fns = \(x) case_when(           x == 1 ~ var_label(x),         .default = NA     ))   ) |>    select(subject, instance_name, contains("starting")) |>    relocate(starting_Other, .after = last_col())  # Merge so far and starting treatments df_pq3 <- df_pq3_sofar |>    left_join(df_pq3_starting, by = c("subject", "instance_name"))

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
code: df_pq4 <- lst_blind_medidata$new_pq_v4 |>   select(subject, instance_name, matches("^newpq14[a-m]_v4"), -contains(c("std"))) |>    labelled::set_variable_labels(     newpq14b_v4 = "ADT",     newpq14d_v4 = "Anti-androgen",     newpq14i_v4 = "EBRT",     newpq14m_v4 = "Other",     subject = NULL,     instance_name = NULL   ) |>    sjlabelled::label_to_colnames() |>    mutate(     # create a set of columns for so far treatments     across(       .cols = -c(subject, instance_name),        .names = "sofar_{.col}",        .fns = \(x) case_when(           x == "So far" ~ cur_column(),         .default = NA       )),     # create a set of columns for starting treatments     across(       .cols = -c(subject, instance_name, contains("sofar")),        .names = "starting_{.col}",        .fns = \(x) case_when(           x == "Starting now" ~ cur_column(),           .default = NA       )),   ) |>    select(subject, instance_name, starts_with("sofar"), starts_with("starting"))

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
code: df_pq5 <- lst_blind_medidata$new_pq_v5 |>   select(subject, instance_name, matches("^newpq14[a-u,]_v5"), -contains(c("std", "14n"))) |>    labelled::set_variable_labels(     newpq14b_v5 = "ADT",     newpq14d_v5 = "Anti-androgen",     newpq14i_v5 = "EBRT",     newpq14m_v5 = "Other",     subject = NULL,     instance_name = NULL   ) |>    sjlabelled::label_to_colnames() |>    mutate(     # create a set of columns for so far treatments     across(       .cols = -c(subject, instance_name),        .names = "sofar_{.col}",        .fns = \(x) case_when(           x == "So far" ~ cur_column(),         .default = NA       )),     # create a set of columns for starting treatments     across(       .cols = -c(subject, instance_name, contains("sofar")),        .names = "starting_{.col}",        .fns = \(x) case_when(           x == "Starting now" ~ cur_column(),           .default = NA       )),   ) |>    select(subject, instance_name, starts_with("sofar"), starts_with("starting"))

title: Comprehensive Ironman Treatment Tutorial
text: creates wide data set combining PQs versions 3, 4 5 set columns treatments continuing far treatment starting. Identify date associated visits. Create data frame information available PQs. example combined pq data looks like single patient.
code: # stack the three questionnaires  df_pq_345 <- bind_rows(     "pq3" = df_pq3,     "pq4" = df_pq4,     "pq5" = df_pq5,     # create an identifier displaying questionnaire source     .id = "pq_version"   ) |>    # clean variable names    janitor::clean_names() |>    # create a single column concatenating all so far treatments   unite(     starts_with("sofar_"),      col = "sofar_trt",      sep = ", ",      remove = FALSE,      na.rm = TRUE     ) |>   # create a single column concatenating all starting treatments   unite(     starts_with("starting_"),      col = "starting_trt",      sep = ", ",      remove = FALSE,      na.rm = TRUE     ) df_visit_date <- lst_blind_medidata$cyc_date |>    select(subject, instance_name, visit_date) |>    # remove observations with missing date   filter(!is.na(visit_date)) |>    # in case of duplicate entries, retain distinct rows   distinct() df_pq_long <- df_pq_345 |>    select(-c(sofar_trt, starting_trt)) |>    pivot_longer(     -c(pq_version, subject, instance_name),     names_to = c("status", "pq_coded_trt"),     # separate column names by first underscore     names_pattern = "^([^_]+)_(.*)",     values_to = "treatment",     values_drop_na = TRUE   ) |>    bind_rows(df_pq1) |>    # join in dates associated with visit   left_join(df_visit_date, by = c("subject", "instance_name")) |>    relocate(visit_date, .after = instance_name) |>    arrange(subject, instance_name) |>  # in case of duplicate entries caused by the pivot, retain distinct rows   distinct()

title: Convenience Functions for the IRONMAN Study
text: goal {ironer} provide convenience functions documentation wrangling data IRONMAN registry https://ironmanregistry.org/. anything unclear use updating, please file issue repository, contact PCCTC data science team zzpdl_pcctc_data_science@mskcc.org.

Experience US health care system Black White patients advanced prostate cancer Cancer. 2023 Aug 15;129(16):2532-2541.

title: Convenience Functions for the IRONMAN Study
text: assign_lot() function used assign line therapy. Researchers may find useful apply data set. Please review Line Therapy vignette caveats usage. assign_baseline_metastatic() function used internally PCCTC create derived baseline metastatic variables subject table (is_metastatic_baseline, origin_metastatic_baseline, date_metastatic_baseline). information available curated data, see particular use researchers. However interested assignment derived may interested review source code.

title: Convenience Functions for the IRONMAN Study
text: data {ironer} package progress subject change. dictionary_medidata Data dictionary clinical data recorded medidata. Subject change. data consists multiple tables. dictionary_proms data set data dictionary Patient Reported Outcomes Measures (PROMS) self-report survey data. survey consists multiple instruments. instruments also multiple versions. Subject change.. treatment_map represents treatment mappings original raw data standardized & recoded treatment assignments. mapping needs corrected added, please file issue contact PCCTC. Note mapping already ca_cm_derived table.

what: Create baseline metastatic flags for IRONMAN participants — assign_baseline_metastatic
title: Create baseline metastatic flags for IRONMAN participants — assign_baseline_metastatic
text: function return whether baseline metastatic disease present site, feasible. aware function specific IRONMAN study. general principles apply studies, function expects certain Medidata field names.

title: Create baseline metastatic flags for IRONMAN participants — assign_baseline_metastatic

title: Create baseline metastatic flags for IRONMAN participants — assign_baseline_metastatic
text: medidata_list list clinical medidata IRONMAN

title: Create baseline metastatic flags for IRONMAN participants — assign_baseline_metastatic
text: list various details baseline metastatic disease classification. primary deliverable metastatic_flags table; remaining tables supplied internal QC purposes.

title: Assign lines of therapy — assign_lot
text: algorithm assigns treatments line occur within 30 days initial treatment line. Treatments occurring greater 30 days line initiation begin new line.

title: Assign lines of therapy — assign_lot
code: assign_lot(   .data,   treatment = treatment,   dt_trt_observed = dt_trt_observed,   dt_treatment_end = dt_treatment_end )

title: Assign lines of therapy — assign_lot
text: .data Data frame treatment information treatment Column containing treatment names dt_trt_observed Column containing treatment start date dt_treatment_end Column containing treatment end date

text: Data frame assigned line therapy regimen information

title: Treatment mapping — treatment_map
text: dataset containing treatment mapping specific PCCTC studies, intended updated regularly. mapping needs corrected added, please file issue contact PCCTC. Note mapping already ca_cm_derived table.

title: Treatment mapping — treatment_map
code: treatment_map

title: Treatment mapping — treatment_map
text: data frame 5 variables: treatment Treatment submitted study treatment_lower Treatment submitted study lower case treatment_recode Assigned treatment standardized coding treatment_category Assigned treatment category is_taxel Indicates treatment taxel (one Cabazitaxel, Docetaxel, Paclitaxel, Tesetaxel) is_nha Indicates treatment novel hormone agent (one Abiraterone, Enzalutamide, Darolutamide, Apalutamide)

title: Treatment mapping — treatment_map
code: print(treatment_map) #> # A tibble: 169 × 6 #>    treatment treatment_lower treatment_recode treatment_category is_taxel is_nha #>    <chr>     <chr>           <chr>            <chr>              <lgl>    <lgl>  #>  1 Casodex … casodex (bical… Bicalutamide     ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #>  2 Nilandro… nilandron (nil… Nilutamide       ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #>  3 Flutamide flutamide       Flutamide        ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #>  4 Degarelix degarelix       Degarelix        ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #>  5 Bicaluta… bicalutamide    Bicalutamide     ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #>  6 Lupron    lupron          Leuprolide       ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #>  7 Testoste… testosterone    Testosterone     Steroid            FALSE    FALSE  #>  8 Zoladex … zoladex (goser… Goserelin        ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #>  9 Leuproli… leuprolide      Leuprolide       ADT                FALSE    FALSE  #> 10 Zometa    zometa          Zoledronic acid  Bisphosphonates    FALSE    FALSE  #> # ℹ 159 more rows

title: ironer 0.1.2 [2025-02-26]

title: ironer 0.1.1 [2025-01-30]
text: README priorrx (prior treatments) treatment (cancer treatments) consolidated single form ca_cm (cancer treatments). Data Dictionary Added sf table Line therapy priorrx (prior treatments) treatment (cancer treatments) consolidated single form ca_cm (cancer treatments). Adjusted text throughout article account form migration Overall made minor text adjustments across site

title: ironer 0.1.0 [2024-06-20]
text: Medidata data priorrx (prior treatments) treatment (cancer treatments) consolidated single form ca_cm (cancer treatments). priorrx, priorrx_derived, treatment, treatment_derived removed ca_cm ca_cm_derived added additionally, pf (sequencing reports) gf (genomics findings) added

title: ironer 0.0.9 [2023-10-18]
text: Medidata documentation Add physician questionnaires information regarding corresponding protocols. Update Medidata dictionary match latest data commons export.

title: ironer 0.0.8 [2023-08-11]
text: README Added additional publications.

title: ironer 0.0.7 [2023-04-20]
text: PROMS data YYYY-MM-DD_proms.csv exports, dbl (numeric) fields eortc_29, eortc_30, ironmisc_12, ironmisc_13, ironmisc_v5_15, ironmisc_v5_16 corrected export character values NA .csv; instead, missing values now appear blank.

title: ironer 0.0.6 [2023-04-17]
text: Medidata data derived indication baseline metastatic, additional logic included count unknown histology additional biopsies (rule 7, mhaddbx) baseline metastatic. affected 6 subjects.

title: ironer 0.0.5 [2023-03-24]
text: Medidata data add basedoneyn, mon12_yn, cyclex_yn general data deliveries. Documentation Update FAQ genetic testing. Add date imputation explanation.

title: ironer 0.0.4 [2022-12-05]
text: updated treatment_map cleaning therapies mapping multiple treatments due capitalization discrepancies.

title: ironer 0.0.3 [2022-11-14]
text: Medidata data added prsurg (Prior Cancer Related Surgery) surg (Cancer Surgery) tables standard data delivery (contains mostly free text responses).

title: ironer 0.0.2 [2022-09-30]
text: Medidata data remove brthdate variables dm table clarify variable label age dm table age consent add race & ethnicity variables captured PROMS subject table update classification baseline metastatic subject table include seventh rule based additional biopsies Medidata dictionary: update dictionary according changes listed data Remove drs_format & drs_entry_type columns; rename drs_prompt_text prompt text PROMS data Due requirements SAS variable names, periods variable names replaced underscores PROMS dictionary Update dictionary according changes listed data

title: ironer 0.0.1 [2022-09-23]
text: Initial release documentation.
